alert.note: Alert for Western Highland (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued May 02 at 4:08AM EDT until May 02 at 10:00AM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM EDT THIS MORNING... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 7 PM THIS EVENING TO 10 AM EDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...For the first Winter Weather Advisory, snow. Additional snow accumulations of up to two inches at elevations above 3000 feet with a slushy coating below 3000 feet. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. For the second Winter Weather Advisory, snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 5 inches above 3000 feet with a coating to a slushy inch or two below 3000 feet. Northwesterly winds gusting as high as 30 to 40 mph. * WHERE...In Virginia, Western Highland County. In West Virginia, Western Grant County. * WHEN...For the first Winter Weather Advisory, until 10 AM EDT this morning. For the second Winter Weather Advisory, from 7 PM this evening to 10 AM EDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning and evening commutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS....The combination of heavy wet snow, strong winds, and green up on trees will enhance the threat for downed trees and power outages above 2,500 feet.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. When venturing outside, watch your first few steps taken on steps, sidewalks, and driveways, which could be icy and slippery, increasing your risk of a fall and injury.
